doc.field: D.A. Knowlton Brooklyn real estate account book
D.A. Knowlton Brooklyn real estate account book

The D.A. Knowlton account book consists of a single bound volume and spans the years 1864 to 1875. The account book lists contracts issued for the sale of real estate in the town of Freeport, Long Island, New York. D.A. Knowlton was a resident of Brooklyn who resided at 5 Montague Street during the mid- and late-nineteenth century.

The D.A. Knowlton account book consists of a single bound volume and spans the years 1864 to 1875. The account book lists contracts issued for the sale of real estate in the town of Freeport, Long Island, New York. D.A. Knowlton was a resident of Brooklyn who resided at 5 Montague Street during the mid- and late-nineteenth century.

The D.A. Knowlton account book consists of a single bound volume and spans the years 1864 to 1875. The account book lists contracts issued for the sale of real estate in the town of Freeport, Long Island, New York. It lists the name of each buyer, the amount paid by the buyer, the date of each payment, and in some instances provides further details regarding each transaction, such as the number of lots purchased. The account book does not provide an explanation of D.A. Knowlton's role in these transactions.
D.A. Knowlton was a resident of Brooklyn who resided at 5 Montague Street during the mid- and late-nineteenth century.
Source and date of acquisition unknown. The account book was formally accessioned in 1973.
